name: firkin
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small barrel (= a round container) used in the past for liquids and butter, normally holding 9 imperial gallons or around 41 litres: He had a firkin of ale hidden in the barn. That year his seven cows produced only two firkins of butter.
More examplesFewer examplesFresh water in seven gallon firkins was hoisted up onto the ship by a winch. They finished off most of the sausages and shared a firkin of ale.Washington should have a state poet laureate and give the bard a firkin of beer.
